metadata.Title: CVE-2019-5874 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Insufficient filtering in URI schemes in Google Chrome on Windows prior to 77.0.3865.75 allowed a remote attacker to bypass navigation restrictions via a crafted HTML page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-5874` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 77.0.3865.90-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 77.0.3865.90-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 77.0.3865.90-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 77.0.3865.90-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 77.0.3865.90-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '77.0.3865.90-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
